fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a JIRA Delegated Authentication Directory is used, and is 'higher' then an Internal JIRA Directory Server, when JIRA Service Desk Attempts to create users, they will be created as users in The JIRA Delegated Authentication Directory by default.

As ServiceDesk users are unlikely to exist in the Delegated LDAP Directory, this results in users who were created in JIRA ServiceDesk (either manually or by public signup) from authenticating with JIRA Service Desk.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA Delegated Authentication Directory, and ensure it is the top directory in the order of User Directories.
# Create a JIRA Service Desk Agent or User from JIRA Service Desk. 
#- Note: you will be unable to supply a password for this user.
# Observe in your User Management that this user has been created in the Delegated Authentication Directory
# Your user will be asked to set their password, but this will fail with the error:
{code}
2015-01-01 01:01:01,042 http-bio-8080-exec-42 ERROR anonymous 111x111x1 - 192.168.0.1 /servicedesk/customer/portal/1/user/setpassword [feature.customer.user.SetPasswordManager] Exception occurred whilst resetting password ' : Passwords are stored in LDAP and are read-only for delegated authentication directory'
{code}
# As No entry exists for the customer in the LDAP Directory, the user is unable to log in.

h3. Expected Results
JIRA Service Desk should either:
- Allow a Service Desk Administrator to choose which User Directory users should be created in. 
- Prevent Users from being created in a Delegated Directory.

h3. Actual Results
As per the reproduction steps, JIRA ServiceDesk defaults to the Delegated Authentication Directory when it is the highest in the order of User Directories. 

This prevents new users that are created, from logging in. 

h3. Workarounds
To workaround this issue, change the order of the User directories, or alternatively, do not use a Delegated Directory and use a connection to a LDAP instead.
fields.summary: ServiceDesk Defaults to Delegated User Directory causing authentication problems

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1796].
  {panel}

I have an issue where JIRA Service Desk Time to Resolution based reports fail to catch issues that had breached before despite using the {{everBreached()}} method.

h5. Steps to replicate:
- Create an SLA for issue Status *Open* -> 1m
- Create an SLA for Issue Status *In Progress* - 5m
-- _Remove all other SLS but this and the one meant for All Remaining Issues_
- Create a new Report
-- Add Series, Time to Resolution-Breached.
-- Add a JQL filter "{{"Time to resolution" = everBreached()}}"
- Create a new issue.
-- Wait for the issue to breach SLA in open Status.
- Move issue to _"in progress"_.
- Close the issue.
- View the "Breached result created above"

h5. Expected Result:
- JIRA would notice the tickets once breached and list them out.

h5. Actual Result.
- JIRA doesn't know that the issue ever breached.

h5. Feature Request:
- Let the result for {{everBreached()}} show what state the issue was in when it breached.
fields.summary: "Time to resolution" = everBreached() not working in Report

{code}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2015-04-21 00:48:37,435 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-1 ERROR ServiceRunner     [mail.incoming.jepp.processor] MailJobRunner Failed

It only happens on BTF customer that are using Oracle DB system.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1792].
  {panel}

h4.Summary: 

An e-mail that is send to the JIRA Service Desk e-mail channel will fail if the e-mail has another e-mail attached to it in the .msg format. This occurs on windows with Service Desk 2.3.5.

h4.Steps to Reproduce:

# Save an e-mail and attach it to another e-mail
# Send this message with the attached e-mail to the e-mail channel

h4.Expected Results:

Issue is created from e-mail

h4.Actual Results:

Error is thrown in atlassian-jira-incoming-mail.log:

{code}2015-04-17 21:31:39,416 ERROR [] atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-3 anonymous     Exception when MailHandlerWorker handles message: 
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at javax.mail.internet.MimeUtility.decodeText(MimeUtility.java:573)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.squalor.email.ServiceDeskMailUtils.addAttachments(ServiceDeskMailUtils.java:310)
	at com.atlassian.servicedesk.squalor.email.ServiceDeskMailUtils.getAttachments(ServiceDeskMailUtils.java:260){code}

h4.Notes:

* The message we have tested it with had a nested attachment (xls format) within the attached e-mail .msg file.
* The same error also happens with .eml as attached files
* The problem seems to be more related with the email client being used than the message attached. From the tests, the problem happens only with Outlook and does not happen with Gmail and the Mac OS X Mail client.
* The same error will happens as well for Email that is coming from Open Technology Real Service(OTRS). [OTRS Email Settings|https://otrs.github.io/doc/manual/admin/stable/en/html/email-settings.html#email]
* The same behaviour also occurs when using Novel Groupwise and both e-mails are from the same domain and this can be avoided using POP instead of IMAP.
* Another one confirmed for an email that is coming from IBM Notes 9.
* Airmail is also confirmed having the same error.
* Zarafa is confirmed having the same error.
fields.summary: Having a .msg attachment or Content-Type: multipart/alternative will not create mail issue, NullPointerException in log file.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1791].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In JIRA Service Desk, when updating an issue, the title of the tabs shown are:
- "Respond to Customer"
- "Internal comment"

Some use-cases for JIRA Service Desk have a different defintion of 'customer', for example the Service Desk may be providing support to "Employees", "Client", "User", etc.

Therefore it would be good to be able to adjust the wording/definition of customer, to other labels.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a Service Desk Ticket
# Observe (as per the Screenshot) that has a fixed title, "Respond to Customer".

h3. Expected Results
There should be an option to define the type of entity which is receiving support via the Service Desk.

h3. Actual Results
There is no method to update this label.
fields.summary: Option to change the name of entity receiving support

fields.description:
Integration of SD with different versions of JIRA randomly created issues when email's body is empty. For example: Integration of JIRA SD 2.3.5 with JIRA 6.4 does not create issues when the email's body is empty, but integration of JIRA SD 2.3.5 with JIRA 6.3.15 Creates issues. h2. Expected Behavior * Issue should not be created as having Summary/subject and Description/body in order to create issue in SD is required. * A log regarding this issue should be printed in _atlassian-jira-incoming-mail.log_ or _atlassian-servicedesk.log_ * Or issue should handled by a reply email to customer as mentioned at [JSD-1780|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-1780] Here is the MIME of an email sent to SD {code} Content-Type: multipart/alternative; boundary=001a11419c4c7306b70513e69f5b --001a11419c4c7306b70513e69f5b Content-Type: text/plain; charset=UTF-8 --001a11419c4c7306b70513e69f5b Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8

--001a11419c4c7306b70513e69f5b-- {code}
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk randomly creates issue for email without body

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1784].
  {panel}

As a customer I'd like to setup where the smart commits are posted when I'm using JSD project.

Scenario: 
- I have a JSD project.
- I have a repository linked to this project
- I have a developer as an Agent
- Every time a developer commits some code using smart commits, JIRA/JSD will interpret this comment and send it to the customer (it will perform a bounce to customer).

There is no way to perform this as an internal comment on JSD project. It would be nice to have a way to config where these smart commits should be performed.
fields.summary: Config Smart Commits as Internal Comments on a JSD project.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1780].
  {panel}

h2. Problem Definition

When customer sends an email to SD to create issue. If the email's body(description) is empty nothing will be created without customer/user being notified about it.


h2. Suggested Solution

An email should be sent to sender of the email and notify the user that their issue has not been created.
fields.summary: Notification to customer if their Email to SD has no description

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1778].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Some request types might require being handled in an external system but the Customer Portal can't be setup to provide a link to another system in lieu of raising the request in JIRA. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for a *Request Type* to be defined that displays information or a link to an external system, but can't be used to create requests in JIRA. 

h3. Why this is important
For example, one Help Desk in an organization us using JIRA Service Desk, but another group in the organization may intake requests using another tool.  

h3. Workaround 
Regardless of which Workaround you ultimately try to use, there are two places built in that you can provide a link to your Customers using standard JIRA markup.  These are:
# The Request Type *Description*
# In the *Help and instructions* section for the Request Type, edited by clicking on the "Edit Fields" link once the Request Type has been created.

h4. Workflow Restriction
To prevent Requests from being created in the first place, you can create a Request Type using an Issue Type associated with a simplified Workflow with a Validator strict enough to prevent the Request from being created.  

For example: A *Permission Validator* requiring *Administer Projects* will result in "Only users with *Administer Projects* permission can execute this transition."

In the Customer Portal, if a normal Customer clicks on *Create* for the associated *Request Type*, they'll receive: {quote}*Error*

User '<username>' doesn't have the 'Administer Projects' permission{quote}
h4. Automation Rule
This approach doesn't prevent the creation of Requests but instead provides a way to automatically handle them while referring Customers to the correct channels.  
In short, create Automation Rule roughly matching:
- *WHEN*: Issue Created
- *IF*: Issue matches a specific *Customer Request Type*
- *THEN*: 
-- Add a comment: {code}Please use [some other system|http://external-link.example.com] to raise this issue{code}
-- Transition issue: Close Ticket

-----
h6. Original Description
{quote}We have a need for some request types that rely on external systems to be created within the external system.  In order to accommodate those, I can currently create a custom field that displays the required information directing the user elsewhere, but in that case, the 'Create' button still exists.

I would like to be able to create request types that display a message, but do not allow for issue submission.

Displaying a given knowledge base article for an issue type would also be a possibility.{quote}
fields.summary: allow request types that display a message only

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1773].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have a JSD project
# Access the customer portal - it should be all ok
!Screen Shot 2015-04-14 at 5.31.22 PM.png|thumbnail!
# Add a status on the workflow (e.g.: Atlassian Test Status) > Publish it
!Screen Shot 2015-04-14 at 5.32.39 PM.png|thumbnail!
# On the JSD project, map this new status
!Screen Shot 2015-04-14 at 5.35.23 PM.png|thumbnail!
# Have some issues running through this status so this status is mentioned on the history of the ticket
!Screen Shot 2015-04-14 at 5.49.30 PM.png|thumbnail!
# Go back to the workflow and change the associated workflow to one that does not use this created status (e.g.: associate it with JIRA default workflow)
# Delete the status from the system
# Go back to customer portal and try to access any page in there 
E.g.: {{https://YOURINSTANCE.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals}}

*Expected Results:*
The customer portal should show up normally.

*Actual Results:*
A stack-trace screen shows up:
!Screen Shot 2015-04-14 at 5.46.08 PM.png|thumbnail!
{code:sql}java.lang.NullPointerException at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.requesttype.RequestStatusMapper.translateToCustomerStatus(RequestStatusService.scala:85) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.RequestActivityProvider$$anonfun$7.apply(RequestActivityProvider.scala:146) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.RequestActivityProvider$$anonfun$7.apply(RequestActivityProvider.scala:140) at scala.collection.TraversableOnce$$anonfun$foldLeft$1.apply(TraversableOnce.scala:144) at scala.collection.TraversableOnce$$anonfun$foldLeft$1.apply(TraversableOnce.scala:144) at scala.collection.Iterator$class.foreach(Iterator.scala:727) at scala.collection.AbstractIterator.foreach(Iterator.scala:1157) at scala.collection.IterableLike$class.foreach(IterableLike.scala:72) at scala.collection.AbstractIterable.foreach(Iterable.scala:54) at scala.collection.TraversableOnce$class.foldLeft(TraversableOnce.scala:144) at scala.collection.AbstractTraversable.foldLeft(Traversable.scala:105) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.RequestActivityProvider.extractRelevantChanges(RequestActivityProvider.scala:140) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.RequestActivityProvider.com$atlassian$servicedesk$internal$feature$customer$request$RequestActivityProvider$$constructItemBuilder(RequestActivityProvider.scala:161) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.RequestActivityProvider$$anonfun$getStatusList$1.apply(RequestActivityProvider.scala:80) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.RequestActivityProvider$$anonfun$getStatusList$1.apply(RequestActivityProvider.scala:79) at scala.collection.TraversableLike$$anonfun$flatMap$1.apply(TraversableLike.scala:251) at scala.collection.TraversableLike$$anonfun$flatMap$1.apply(TraversableLike.scala:251) at scala.collection.Iterator$class.foreach(Iterator.scala:727) at scala.collection.AbstractIterator.foreach(Iterator.scala:1157) at scala.collection.IterableLike$class.foreach(IterableLike.scala:72) at scala.collection.AbstractIterable.foreach(Iterable.scala:54) at scala.collection.TraversableLike$class.flatMap(TraversableLike.scala:251) at scala.collection.AbstractTraversable.flatMap(Traversable.scala:105) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.RequestActivityProvider.getStatusList(RequestActivityProvider.scala:79) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.RequestActivityProvider.getActivity(RequestActivityProvider.scala:133) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.IssueViewProvider.getIssueListItemViewCommon(IssueViewProvider.scala:225) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.IssueViewProvider.getIssueListItemView(IssueViewProvider.scala:216) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.RequestListProvider$IssueToRequestListItemViewMapper$$anonfun$toRequestListItemViewWithPortal$1$$anonfun$apply$19.apply(RequestListProvider.scala:386) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.RequestListProvider$IssueToRequestListItemViewMapper$$anonfun$toRequestListItemViewWithPortal$1$$anonfun$apply$19.apply(RequestListProvider.scala:379) at scala.Option.map(Option.scala:145) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.RequestListProvider$IssueToRequestListItemViewMapper$$anonfun$toRequestListItemViewWithPortal$1.apply(RequestListProvider.scala:379) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.RequestListProvider$IssueToRequestListItemViewMapper$$anonfun$toRequestListItemViewWithPortal$1.apply(RequestListProvider.scala:378) at scala.Option.flatMap(Option.scala:170) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.RequestListProvider$IssueToRequestListItemViewMapper.toRequestListItemViewWithPortal(RequestListProvider.scala:378) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.RequestListProvider$$anonfun$10.apply(RequestListProvider.scala:193) at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.feature.customer.request.RequestListProvider$$anonfun$10.apply(RequestListProvider.scala:193) at scala.collection.TraversableLike$$anonfun$map$1.apply(TraversableLike.scala:244) at scala.collection.TraversableLike$$anonfun$map$1.apply(TraversableLike.scala:244) at scala.collection.immutable.List.foreach(List.scala:318) a{code}

*Workaround:*
# Search for statuses that have an entry on an issue's history but are not present on the status table. Run:
{code:sql}select distinct newvalue
from changeitem 
where field = 'status' 
  and (newvalue not in (select id from issuestatus))
UNION 
select distinct oldvalue
from changeitem 
where field = 'status' 
  and (oldvalue not in (select id from issuestatus));{code}
(!) The query might not be compatible for all databases. Please modify it accordingly
# Create a ghost status on the system
# Run an update on the database to link the deleted status to this new ghost status
{code:sql}update issuestatus set id = 'OldID' where id = 'NewID'; --oldID = id found on the previous search newID = id from the new status created{code}
# Run a lock-reindex

(i) If you are using Cloud, raise a ticket with Support Team (support.atlassian.com) so they can apply this workaround.

*Add-on Version:*
JIRA v6.4-OD-16-006
JIRA Service Desk v2.4
fields.summary: NPE while accessing Customer Portal when a status has been deleted from workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1770].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Service Desk Agents {{secure/admin/AgentAllocation.jspa}} only shows the first 20 users on the page, with no pagination options. Customer currently needs to go to user management and see which users are assigned Service Desk Agents permission group.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide pagination option to be able to view more than 20 agents.

h3. Workaround 
Visit the group specific to agents in user management to review current agents.
fields.summary: Provide pagination on Service Desk Agents page to view more than 20 agents

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1769].
  {panel}

*Summary:*

Adding an attachment link to a comment used to link the Service Desk attachment link {{https://<instance-name>/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/10200/10200_test.pdf}} instead of {{https://<instance-name>/secure/attachment/10200/test.pdf}}. Since Customer does not have access to JIRA, the attachment can't be accessed. This is related to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-1726 where the workaround provided is to use [^test.png] instead of [description of attachment|attachment link] .

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Agent adds the attachment using this format [^test.png]

*Expected Result:*
- Customer should be able to access it without having JIRA application access

*Current Result:*
- Customer is not able to access it.

*Workaround:*

-  For now if the customer wants to directly access the attachments; the agent have to manually provide the Service Desk URL instead; which is {{https://<instance-name>/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/<ATTACHMENT_ID>/<ATTACHMENT_ID>_<FILE_NAME>}}
fields.summary: Attachment links are directing to JIRA instead of Service Desk

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1768].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there are some limitations on the actions that the Collaborators role can execute (for example, logging work). However, this is not sent across properly to the users/admin, causing misunderstandings.

h3. Suggested Solution

Perhaps provide some more details about the roles and the users in the marketing materials.
fields.summary: As an admin I would like the limitations of the Collaborators role to be better documented

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1764].
  {panel}

Multiple Issue Type for Customer Request Type (CRT).

With this feature one can change the Issue Type without clearing Customer Request Type. This makes recategorization of a Ticket viable and easy in for example a workflow transition. A Request for IT Help could be both an Incident and Service Request.

As a Service Desk Agent I want to easily change the Issue Type while keeping Customer Request Type so that I can still see how the Ticket was submitted so that I can later Report on total "Requests for Help" and distuingish on how many are actually Incidents or Service Requests. 

As it is today when you change Issue Type CRT is cleared. Workaround is to either create a custom field "ITIL Classification" or create multiple CRT with different Issue Type, but then Customer has to decide whether said issue is Request or Incident.

A workaround Suggestion is Sub Issue Types for JIRA Project.
fields.summary: Multiple Issue Type for Customer Request Type

fields.description:
h4.Summary: 

The language settings for JIRA Service Desk seem to not be applied everywhere / properly.

h4.Steps to Reproduce:

# Set JIRA System language to non-english
# Set user language to english.
# Go in to Service Desk
# Check the Service Desk queues

h4.Expected Results:

The language used should be english

h4.Actual Results:

It seems to be a mix of english and the system default language (please see attached screenshot)
fields.summary: Default JIRA language overrides user language preset.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As an addon using the JIRA IssueService to create issues, it is not possible to create issues with Labels atomically, this needs to be done as a post-create activity.  This activity will work fine when a JIRA account holder has the EDIT_ISSUE permission in JIRA but *will not work* when the project is JSD enabled, regardless of Permission Scheme permission.

The only way that labels can be set 'correctly' is if the 'user' involved is a member of the service-desk-agents group, which is not viable for JIRA account holder customers.

The only workaround I can see for this is to just ignore security and just setting the labels directly.
fields.summary: Addons unable to set Labels in JSD enabled projects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1756].
  {panel}

I find this a major weakness in this application by not allowing such functionality, especially as it has a "Service Desk" function now. Lets face it, most big companies these days strive to base their processes around ITIL methodology, the last 3 I have been involved with have anyway (3000 employees, 73000 and 300).

This is the first time I have come across JIRA and as a Service Desk Manager find it quite limiting. While I understand this tool is fundamentally based around Agile PM, Service Desk functionality is very cumbersome and limiting.

I know SD is only in its early stages, I just hope this gets addressed as automating process for standard changes and incidents etc should be standard in almost any service desk product.

Why is it important?

If I have a standardised task which does not change and follows the same path of implementation every time, I should be able to use a workflow to automate that entire process. Tasks we have should auto generate upon specific status changes or assignment or closure of other tickets.
Assigning to multiple "assignees" is wasteful and creates too many overheads around future administration. ie. if one person leaves, you now have to update that workflow or any other workflow that person was a part of. If it was a group, then you have nothing to do whatsoever except update the one group.

The only solution for this is to allow the assignment of issues to groups.

Right now, we have to manually create every single ticket, monitor queues etc. Wasting my technical resources time that could be better spent on improving processes for our customers.
fields.summary: Workflow Improvement to allow assignment to Groups

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1755].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Update as of 11 September 2015|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
This issue has been tracked down to a inconsistency at the indexing level inside JIRA.

To fix this, a workaround has been added to the Automation module for a 2.5.7 Service Desk release. This workaround will schedule a consistency task between 30 seconds - 2 minutes of the workflow transition rule executing. If the reindex initially may have got the queues into an inconsistent state, this task will reload the issue from database and index again.

However, the real fix will be available from JIRA 7.0.0 (JSD 3.0.0) where on every reindex, the issue will be reloaded before indexing, to prevent these inconsistencies occurring at all.
{panel}

I have a Service Desk workflow that is triggering transitions when the issue is commented upon (similar to the default Service Desk workflow).  It appears that at least some of the time, the issue does not re-index when it is transitioned by the automation.  When I view the issue in the queue, it shows one status, and when I view the issue on the normal view screen it has a different (correct) status.  Making any edit to the issue that forces a re-index brings both statuses inline with each other.

Automation details
|| When || If || Then ||
| Issue Commented | Status = "Waiting for Support"
Comment is public
User is agent | Transition "Respond to customer" |
|| || Else If || Then ||
| | Status = "Waiting for Customer
User is not agent | Transition "Respond to support" |
fields.summary: Changes from automation do not fire a re-index on the issue

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1754].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in order to have JIRA Service Desk's *Request Type* set for issues created through JIRA itself, the user must manually edit the issue *after* it is created, which causes both confusion and frustration:
- JSD-830
- JSD-1445

h3. Suggested Solution
The *Request Type* field should be made visible when creating an issue as well.
fields.summary: As a JIRA User, I'd like to set the Request Type while Creating an Issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1752].
{panel}


{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 9 June 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this suggestion.

We have identified that this is a duplicate of _"Auto-refresh and/or warn user if the ticket has changed"_ JSDSERVER-433. We are actively reviewing this suggestion and will continue to track interest on the other ticket. Please watch JSDSERVER-433 for future updates.

Kind regards,

Alex

Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center 
{panel}



When we have an issue in 'Waiting for Customer' status and the customer triggers the transition to 'Waiting for Support' by commenting on the issue, the customer's comment is added, but the page is not refreshed after the transition is made.

That results in the page showing the old status (Waiting for Customer) and the customer has to refresh the page to see the new status.

This makes the customers confused, as it is not clear that the transition was correctly triggered. They escalate or raise new cases which steals time from getting them the support they need.
fields.summary: Automatic transitions are not visible to Customers without a refresh

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Our Jira instance contains many public project (browse rights are provided to anyone) and Service Desk. As soon as our customer is logged into Service Desk, he is always redirected to customer portal. He has to log off to be able to browse public project.

It was not the case in 2.1.

To reproduce:
 - create a service desk customer
 - create a Jira project, create at least one issue and provide browse rights to 'Anyone'
 - log into Service Desk using customer account
 - try to browse Jira project issues
fields.summary: Users with role "Service desk customers" cannot browse any Jira project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1748].
  {panel}

I just do some tests with Jira service desk and Confluence.
It is very nice that my customers do not waste User licences in Jira! Awesome!
But if i wan`t my customers in Servicedesk to be able to searche knowledge base articles in confluence, i have to add them to my Confluence User Directory, so they waste my user licences in confluence.
This does not make sense!
I don`t want to enable anonymous access to our confluence. So i have to upgrade my confluence license if my customers want to use my knowledge base in confluence.

Please create a possibility that Service Desk Customers are able to search confluence articles without wasting user licenses.
Thank you very much
fields.summary: User configuration Confluence - Jira Service desk

fields.description: The message threshold limit needs to be set to 0 in our configuration (otherwise we experience the BAD error described here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/BAD+Command+Argument+Error+when+creating+issue+via+email+with+Microsoft+Exchange) Everytime we do an update to JIRA Service Desk, the threshold limit is reset to 5 which causes the error to return. This started with one of the 2.3.* releases: Installed add-ons jira-email-processor-plugin (com.atlassian.jira.jira-email-processor-plugin), jira-issue-nav-components (com.atlassian.jira.jira-issue-nav-components), Atlassian Pretty URLs Plugin (com.atlassian.prettyurls.atlassian-pretty-urls-plugin) - bundled with add-on JIRA Service Desk	Feb 23 2015 9:07:56 PM
fields.summary: JIRA Service Desk plugin upgrades reset the Message Threshold limit in the Advanced mail loop detection configuration

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1745].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Have a JSD project
# Visit the customer portal
# Select the issue to create
# Fill out the fields
# Hit Create (and keep hiting Create until the window closes)
See screencast: http://screencast.com/t/kVnq50ajo

*Expected Results:*
JSD would disable the Create button and keep it that way until the entire creating process is done.

*Actual Results:*
JSD disables the Create button for a while, but before the window closes, it re-activates it again (which is probably causing this issue).

*Workaround:*
Wait for JSD to dismiss that window.

*Add-on Version:*
JIRA Service Desk v2.4-OD-05-001-D20150322T231214
fields.summary: Service Desk creating duplicate tickets

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a Dummy Service Desk Project.
# Specify the Email Settings and Turn On the Public Sign Up for the Dummy Service Desk Project.
# Go to JIRA and configure the Outgoing Mail/Notification.
# Using Email Address A that is not registered yet, sent an email to create the issue and a user on the Service Desk Project.
# The User will be notified about the issue cretion and get an invitation link.
# Using Email Address B which also not registered as a user, use the same Subject as the Notification Email Subject that Email Address A received.
# Then with the same subject and a body, sent an email to the Dummy Service Desk project Mail Server.

*Expected Result:*
* Like in JIRA, the user will be created and it will make a comment on the existing ticket.

*Actual Result:*
* The user is not created and the email is rejected.

*Notes:*
* Have tested in JIRA side with a "Create User" option enabled, the User will be created and a comment will be added on the mentioned ticket.
fields.summary: Commenting to an Existing Ticket through Email would not Create the User

h3. Problem Definition
Incoming requests have to be either manually picked or assigned from the queue.
The only alternatives for automatically assigning issues are:
- Assigning it to the project lead; or
- Assigning it to a component lead.

fields.description:
As a full JIRA account holder (has _jira-users_ group, referred in the default DESK Role 'Request participants') with specific EDIT_ISSUE permission (by role and name) in a the demo DESK JSD project:  Using IssueService, I can create issues without a problem, but IssueService.validateUpdate() returns an error _You do not have permission to edit issues in this project_.

I've traced this to be the call _permissionManager.hasPermission(Permissions.EDIT_ISSUE, issue, user)_, I lost track inside what I think is a custom impl of the permission manager?

I log this as a bug, because, the user has EDIT_ISSUE permission, there are no workflow step restrictions that would prevent this, and if JSD is disabled, I don't see this running the same test in the same project.
fields.summary: During update, get: You do not have permission to edit issues in this project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1736].
  {panel}

As an administrator I want to force ALL users to use the customer portal instead of "Create Issue" in the JIRA interface. This includes agents, customers who are JIRA users, and customers who are not JIRA users. 
* Currently, users are able to create issues in the Service Desk project using this "Create Issue" button. This allows them to bypass the Customer Portal and the request types that I have defined. Issues created like this do not use the form I created and do not show in the portal.

----

Currently JIRA Service Desk requires the Create Issue permission for two project roles, Service Desk Team and Administrators. Having this permission allows agents to create issues through the JIRA channel using the Create Issue function in JIRA. 
* If these permissions are not present an error will appear like discussed [here | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Resolving+permission+scheme+errors]
* Removing these permissions does not prevent agents from creating issues in the portal or through the email channel. 

As an admin, I may need to give some users Create Issue permission but do not want these users to be able to create issues in the Service Desk project using the Create Issue function in JIRA. I need to be able to give some users this permission so that issues can be created using, for example:
* API
* Issue collectors
* Regular JIRA mail handlers
* Add-ons
fields.summary: Prevent issues from being created through JIRA Channel using Create Issue function

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1726].
  {panel}

*Summary:*
Based on this [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Getting+started+for+service+desk+agents#Gettingstartedforservicedeskagents-Workoncustomerissues], it shows that it's possible to add attachment by copying the link from Agent view:
{quote}
To ensure that the customer sees the attachment, right click on the attachment to copy link address and paste the link into a comment surrounded by square brackets as follows: [description of attachment|attachment link]. Click preview to confirm the attachment link has copied correctly: 
{quote}

When users copy the link, the URL will be {{https://<instance-name>/secure/attachment/10200/test.pdf}} instead of {{https://<instance-name>/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/10200/10200_test.pdf}}. Since Customer does not have access to JIRA, the attachment can't be accessed.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Customer create a new issue
# Agent adds an attachment and right click to copy the attachment link
# The URL will be {{https://<instance-name>/secure/attachment/10200/test.pdf}}
# Agent adds the attachment using this format[description of attachment|attachment link]

*Expected Result:*
- Customer should be able to access it without having JIRA application access

*Current Result:*
- Customer is not able to access it

*Workaround:*
- -Use this format [ ^description.ext ] to add the attachment-

- The workaround above no longer works as even when linking the files in the chat; the file is pointing to  {{https://<instance-name>/secure/attachment/10200/test.pdf}} (JIRA) and no longer point to Service Desk. For now if the customer wants to directly access the attachments; the agent have to manually provide the Service Desk URL instead; which is {{https://<instance-name>/servicedesk/customershim/secure/attachment/<ATTACHMENT_ID>/<ATTACHMENT_ID>_<FILE_NAME>}}
fields.summary: Adding attachment by copying the link from Agent view is not visible to the Customer

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1725].
  {panel}

Currently, we could configure JIRA Service Desk SLA goals based on the JQL and the Calendar to take the Working Hours information. While this could be used for goals that is specific to Priority or the details about the issue, it does not support SLA goals that is based on time. There some users that is set the SLA Goals based on the time when it is created, in which the SLA will adapt when it is passed a specific hours. While currently we could specify multiple goals for the same JQL filter, JIRA Service Desk will refer to the most top goals if it were the same. Not to include when the SLA is passed the working hours, it would stop until the next day.

For example about the SLA that is based on time:
bq. When a ticket is created at 17:50 the time starts to count towards the 2 hour goal until 18:00. Then at 18:00 the working hours stop and the goal is set to 3 hours with 10 minutes already subtracted from that and the time continues on counting towards the 3 hours goal.

Hence, it would be great if JIRA Service Desk to have an option to make goals moved or continue to a different calendar based on the time.

h5. Update:

If a user has 2 calendars and an issue is worked on in one calendar and transfered to another calendar, if the work was done before the working hours of the calendar, the amount of SLA already expended is not carried over.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create 2 calendars (9-5) say one for GMT+8 and another for GMT-5.
# Create a select list custom field TimeZone with values (America) and (APAC) accordingly.
# Add the field to the Create, View and Edit Issue screen of your Service Desk project.
# Create SLA goals with for example {{request type = "Service Request" and TimeZone = America}}.
# Use the GMT-5 Calendar for the America based goals and repeat similar for APAC.
# Create an issue and Select a specific timezone say APAC which matches the issue type of the goal.
# Note the time.
# Transition the issue so that the SLA is met or time is consumed from it.
# Change the TimeZone field to America.

h5. Customer Expectation

The Consumed time is accounted for following this change.

h5. Actual Result

JIRA going by working calendar would not count anytime consumed from earlier SLA if the working time does not fall within the working time of the new calendar.
fields.summary: SLA to Continue Between Calendars based on Time

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1724].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When an Agent sends an email to Service Desk with a CCed user, the user is not added to the Request Participant field.

This only works if the option "Customers can add participants to their requests" is enabled at the Service Desk configuration page (_Settings > Request Participants(Under CUSTOMER REQUESTS) > Request Participants_)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure the option "Customers can add participants to their requests" is disabled
# Send email from an agent to Service Desk mail server with another user CCed

h3. Expected Results
User is added to the ticket as the Request Participant

h3. Actual Results
User is not added
fields.summary: Request Participant not added by Agent when CCed

fields.description:
I have two directories.  "Jira Internal Directory" and "Atlassian Crowd Directory".

The internal directory is at the "top" and is the default directory.  This way, when customers self sign-up, their accounts are created in the jira directory (default directory), not the crowd directory.

When following the instructions to enable SSO by changing the Authenticator

<authenticator class="com.atlassian.jira.security.login.SSOSeraphAuthenticator"/>

Users can no longer authenticate to the "Internal Jira Directory" because the authenticator doesn't check the internal directory.
fields.summary: Customers Cannot Login with SSO Enabled

fields.description:
If you have "public sign-up" turned on, users are created in the Crowd directory not the Internal directory (assuming the Crowd directory is at the top of the user directories list).  

If your crowd directory application is "closed", meaning you have setup Groups that are allowed to login to Jira (not the entire directory), then the user will not e able to login to the service desk as they cannot authenticate to the Crowd application.

there is no way to establish a "Default Group" for customers except to establish a default group in the Crowd Directory Application for new users.

In any case, creating customers in Crowd is a NON-STARTER.  There is no way I can afford the license to do so.

See JSD-1716
fields.summary: Customers Cannot Login if using Crowd Server and closed Application

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1716].
  {panel}


When multiple directories exist (Crowd and Internal Directory), public sign-up should have a dropdown box indicating which directory to add "customers" to.

I cannot afford a 5,000 user Crowd server license the cost is just way beyond the realm of reality.  I don't want customers created in my crowd server anyway!!!!!  

Jira Service Desk customers should either 

a) be created ONLY in the INTERNAL directory
or
b) specify which directory to create customer users on the configuration tab
fields.summary: Directory for Customers

fields.description:
All fields are wrapped in {{<div class="field-group">}} but radio button groups are wrapped in {{<fieldset class="group">}} instead, which doesn't have bottom margin that field-group does, so the fields all run together, as seen in attached [^request_form.png].

I would suggest at least 25px bottom margin to separate fields, see attached [^suggested.png].

As an aside, perhaps there should be a setting for Service Desk where one could paste custom CSS, similar to what is currently possible in Confluence. This way issues in Service Desk could be fixed on the fly while waiting for an official bug fix.
fields.summary: Poor spacing between radio button groups on request form

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create two dummy Service Desk.
# Configure an Application Link to Confluence with 2-Legged OAuth Authentication (2LOA) between the applications.
# Link one of the Service Desk project to a Confluence Space.
# Create an article/page on the Space.
# Log out and access the Main Portal as one of the Customer.
# Search for a Solution with the space name or article name on the Main Portal.
# Click on the drop down search result.

*Expected Result:*
It will shown the article content

*Actual Result:*
It will shown a blank pop-up window or an error message from the browser.

*Notes:*
* If we go inside the linked customer portal, the search pop-up will worked perfectly.
* On the testing, it will actually ask for login to Confluence, either in Main Portal or Customer Portal. This is related to linked issue below.
* On some time, in the Main Portal the pop-up will show the Confluence Login notification overtime even though it is already logged in.
fields.summary: Search pop-up for Confluence KB/Solution on the Main Portal shows blank

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1708].
{panel}
{panel}
*Atlassian status update as of 15th January 2018*
{panel}
Hi all,

Good news - The ability to disable welcome email is now available in Jira Service Desk version 3.10.
 To find out more about this fix, check out our release notes [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-10-x-release-notes-941610925.html#JIRAServiceDesk3.10.xreleasenotes-ver].

On behalf of the JSD team, I want to thank all of you for contributing to this ticket. Your patience and feedback have shaped this enhancement.

Cheers,

Vidhu Sharma
 Product Manager - Jira Service Desk
{panel}
*Atlassian update as of 23rd May 2017*
{panel}
Hi all,

Thanks for your feedback on this. We are aware that this is important and understand that the account activation email is causing confusion for your customers. 

Welcome emails are instance wide and span across multiple projects, which is why modifying them is challenging. We are now exploring the possibility of suppressing these emails and building a new flow for users to activate accounts.

Once again, thanks for voicing your concerns and stay tuned for future updates. 

Cheers,

JIRA Service Desk Team

 
----
h3. Problem Definition

Due to reduce the number of communication between JIRA and users, some administrators would like to disable the Welcome messages
 * Welcome messages are also referred to as "Activate Your Account" emails

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the new customer welcome message as a notification type that can be edited within the notification scheme.
h3. Example Use Case

"We are running into a problem with JIRA service desk whereby we need to allow for open customer enrollment, but we do not support a portal site and do not want to link customers to that site in their update emails. The entire Welcome email is entirely unnecessary for this reason, and while we can use the default JIRA notifications as a way to update customers, we would like to be able to just change the outgoing emails from Service Desk the same as with JIRA notifications. "
fields.summary: Provide ability to disable the welcome email to new customers

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Improve Strip Quotes or allow mail handler configuration

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1706].
  {panel}

When replying to a Service Desk issue from a Customer, the issue is transitioned to "Waiting for Customer" automatically. 

I would prefer to make that transition explicit, since many times a reply is simply informative and does not require a response from the Customer. Simply responding to a request should not then put the issue back in the Customer's "court". 

Perhaps clicking the "Respond to Customer" button could cause the transition and simply typing in the comment field does not. Maybe the transition could be changed to "Request information from Customer" or something similar so that it's obviously a transition.

As it is, I reply with a message saying something like "Thanks, I understand the request and will let you know what we find" and then I have to click the "Respond to Support" button so that it transitions back to Waiting for Support. This also triggers an unnecessary email notification.

Thanks.
fields.summary: External comments should not transition issue by default

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1705].
  {panel}

Hello,

I've created a jira project. At a later moment I've installed the jira service desk plugin and configured the project for use with the servicedesk plugin. I've created an issuetype with servicedesk screen, etc.. When a customer creates an issue of the defined issuetype, the customer doesn't see the issue in his list of issues (the counter has not changed).
I've created a new jira-project and made the issuetype I allready defined available in the new project. When the customer creates an issue (of the same issuetype) in the new project, the issue is added to the customers list of issues (the counter is changed by 1).
Do you have any idea what the problem might be? Does it have something to do with the fact that my first project was created before I installed and configured the service desk module?

With kind regards,
Niels Koreman
fields.summary: Issue created in customer portal is not shown in customer list of issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1700].
  {panel}

As of JIRA Service Desk 2.1, it is possible to use the Raise this request on behalf of feature from within the Customer Portal to create a request for a customer, and they will receive the email.

But for the times I need to create a ticket in JIRA and change the Reporter role, it would be nice for the customer to get an email notification when I have edited the Request Type and made it viewable from within the portal.

Currently I can add an external comment to the ticket, and the customer will receive this message, but it would be good to be automated.

*Flow*

* Create ticket in JIRA (for a SD project) and change reporter to customer
* Set the customer request type for the ticket

*Expected outcome*

* Customer receives an email stating that request is available to view

*Workaround*

As an agent, use the Raise this request on behalf of feature within the Customer Portal.
Notifications will be sent correctly on issue create, in this scenario.
fields.summary: When Raise Request on behalf of customer from JIRA and change request type a notification should be sent

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1699].
  {panel}

JIRA Service Desk have the "Public Sign Up" feature that will let unregistered user that accessing the portal to be able to sign up and create an account, this also includes for unregistered user that is sent request through email. When a unregistered user sent an email to Service Desk email channel, the email will be converted to a request and an invitation link will sent out to the sender to notify them. 

But, at some situation, the sender of the email will forward the created request notification to another user that will be take part on that request, and there is a possibility that the user that received the forward email is an unregistered user as well. Then, that user will reply to Service Desk email channel with the same subject as the previous notification with intend to update/comment on the ticket. Since this user is not registered yet, Service Desk will process the email but did not do aything with it as the subject is the same and it is from an unregistered user email address.

Hence, it will be great if JIRA Service Desk Public Sign Up will cover those unregistered user that have an intend to comment on an existing ticket. Making the user does not need to access the portal and sign up just to do a simple comment, also it will automatically include the user as the participant of that request.

It could perhaps be good to add some sort of approve-mechanism, if an user wants to comment on an issue, but aren't allowed because the user user is not in request participant list. As if it is possible, it would make the customer to be added to the request which could lead to a security issues.
fields.summary: Support Create User function even for Comment by Email

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1696].
  {panel}

The release notes for JSD prior to 2.0 are no longer available, error appears saying page has been deleted.

Example: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/JIRA+Service+Desk+1.2.5+Release+Notes

These notes are linked to from JAC and also from the JSD version history in MAC and should be restored so that they are accessible from these links.

In addition, JIRA admins may be using pre-2.0 Service Desk and may no intentions on upgrading. The release notes should be accessible to these admins.
fields.summary: Missing release notes for JSD prior to 2.0

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1695].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
As a Service Desk Administrator, I would like a method to 'skip' the on-boarding/Chaperone experience if I am creating my first Service Desk in the JIRA instance.

This would be useful if I have had previous experience in another Service Desk environment and do not need to be shown the basics. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Service Des Administrator User 
# Create a new Service Desk

h3. Expected Results
Have an option to 'Skip' the on-boarding/Chaperone experience.

h3. Actual Results
No option to 'Skip' the on-boarding experience is available at this time.
fields.summary: Add  'skip' option to on-boarding experience after creating a new Service Desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*How to reproduce:*
* As a normal JIRA user, create an issue in JIRA.
* Assign a JSD customer as "Request participants". This user is neither collaborator nor has he the browse project permission.
* Write an internal comment

⇒ The customer can see the internal comment
⇒ The comment is not indicated as being internal with the red lock symbol
⇒ The comment can not be made internal

*Workaround:*
* Instead of opening the issue in JIRA, open it over the portal and assign the customer to the "Request participants". In an issue created this way, the comments work as expected.
* (Do not write nasty internal comments about your customers ;-) )
fields.summary: Issue created in JIRA → Can't write internal comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1689].
  {panel}

Hi guys, 
when a Service Desk contains more than 20 customers, on the screen People | Customers, you see only first 20 customers without any way to see all of them. This is a bit inconsistent compared to the user management screen in JIRA. 

Would you mind to add pagination control on the bottom on the page? Many thanks

Jarda
fields.summary: Pagination on customers' list
